Articles.Content:
Years ago I used Partition Magic, but it seems to be dead and never to support Windows 7 anyway.

Which easy to use program would you recommend a friend to give c: some gigs of d: without deleting everything?

I usually use [Gparted Live](http://gparted.org/livecd.php) or [PartedMagic](https://partedmagic.com/). Both run from USB or CD and support NTFS. Don't touch the system/UEFI partitions.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-12T09:03:33Z" title="06/12/2015 09:03  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 12, 2015</time> by steve\_v**

> 
> Don't touch the system/UEFI partitions.

But it is exactly what needs to be made bigger ...
Moving the end of C: should be fine, I refer to the 'system reserved' partition.
